pr_title: KOGITO-764: Create a Guided Tour for first time users on DMN editor

timeline.bodyText: Maybe we could be consistent in naming and use init instead of initialize. WDYT?
timeline.author: jomarko

timeline.bodyText: Could we please add javadoc to new classes which do not implement new interfaces from appformer part of ensemble?
timeline.author: jomarko

timeline.bodyText: Could you please explain why this is needed? I see graphObserver and gridObserver has @Observes annotation in use. Then if I remember correctly is enough to fire such event instance from any other place and java ee world will invoke those @Observes methods. Why do we need to store and pass graphObserver and and gridObserver instances?
timeline.author: jomarko

replies.bodyText: Each GuidedTourObserver has it's own domain, and it's disposed by the bridge monitor when it's necessary. So, it's just a matter of separating responsibilities :-)
replies.author: karreiro

timeline.bodyText: I think we can improve the naming. Utils suffix suggest to me set of public methods related to position, however the only one public method is a one of given PositionProvider interface. Should we rename Utils suffix?
timeline.author: jomarko

replies.bodyText: Nice idea! Thanks! Now we have PositionProviderFactories :-)
replies.author: karreiro

timeline.bodyText: Spotted here, it is more related to appformer part of ensemble, why we please need appformer Rect next to elemenatl2 ClientRect. They seem to have the same functionality.
timeline.author: jomarko

replies.bodyText: The Rect belongs to the Guided Tour domain, it gives us more flexibility to evolve the API. So, I prefer not to couple the Guided Tour API the native ClientRect.
replies.author: karreiro

timeline.author: jomarko

timeline.bodyText:
Some of these are very hard to understand. I mean to know what part of our editor is is.
If we merge kiegroup/appformer#987 and #3333 before this ensmeble, could be some of your locators improved?
timeline.author: jomarko

replies.bodyText: Atm I'm trying to avoid to invest more effort on these steps, we will iterate over them after the next UX output, so I believe it's better to keep it as is for now.
replies.author: karreiro

timeline.bodyText: Could you please explain this 101 number?
timeline.author: jomarko

replies.bodyText:
Each tutorial can have any label, it enables the use of one tutorial referencing other at runtime. So, a tutorial can have any string label... regarding the 101 term:

101 ("one-o-one") is a topic for beginners in any area. It has all the basic principles and concepts that are expected in a particular field. Source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/101_(topic)
replies.author: karreiro

timeline.bodyText: We should pass action as GuidedTourActions instead of String. This way will clearly define set of allowed values.
timeline.author: jomarko

replies.bodyText: UserInteraction belongs to Guided Tour domain, while the GuidedTourActions belongs to DMN web-app domain. From Guided Tour perspective, we want to be more flexible and leave it as string, so API users are able to define their own observers and trigger their own user interactions.
replies.author: karreiro

timeline.bodyText: Similar comment as above, we should have enum to clearly define set of allowed values.
timeline.author: jomarko

replies.bodyText: TypeScript defines, by using union types, allowed values for this. I prefer to keep it simple and just add a Java doc at the Step class for now, and see how this kind of API will evolve when BPMN start using this API.
replies.author: karreiro

timeline.bodyText: Could we please implement OuiaComponent interface introduced as part of kiegroup/appformer#987 and #333?
timeline.author: jomarko

replies.bodyText: Can we handle it in a separate JIRA? I'd like to deeply check the impact of this on the Guided Tour.
replies.author: karreiro

timeline.author: jomarko

timeline.bodyText: I think to provide more context we should name the variable like nodeName.
timeline.author: jomarko
